column4: Amazon may benefit as digital goods sales jump
column5: Digital goods are the fastest-growing category online this holiday  led by e-books  suggesting Amazon.com Inc's strategy of blanketing the world with cheap e-readers and tablet computers may be producing some early gains.

column4: Insight: More solar firms set to burn up as prices sink
column5: Only four years ago  hundreds of start-ups optimistically built factories and churned out solar panels to meet rising demand. Now  closures and failure loom for many.

column4: Intel's smartphone guru angles for smooth landing
column5: SANTA CLARA  California Mike Bell likens his new job at Intel Corp to piloting a glider.

column4: Momenta shares rise on biosimilars deal with Baxter
column5: Shares of Momenta Pharmaceuticals  rose as much as 7 percent early Friday  a day after it inked a deal with Baxter International Inc   marking the third partnership on generic versions of biotechnology drugs this month.

column4: Netflix CEO Reed Hastings takes $1.5 million pay cut
column5: NEW YORK (TheWrap.com) - Netflix CEO Reed Hastings is getting the corporate equivalent of coal in his Christmas stocking -- a pay cut.

column4: News Corp near hiring new top lawyer: source
column5: NEW YORK News Corp  is close to hiring Gerson Zweifach as its top corporate lawyer  bringing in the highly regarded litigator at a time when the company is dealing with the fallout from its phone-hacking scandal.

column5: AT&T Inc said late on Thursday that it won regulatory approval to buy wireless spectrum from U.S. chipmaker Qualcomm Inc  a move that would boost the company's 4G network.

column5: Bank of America Corp  is lagging behind its major U.S. competitors in complying with new capital rules  leading the bank to consider even more asset sales  sources said.

column4: U.S. shoppers less than merry after online glitches

column4: Bristol-Myers liver cancer drug fails trial
column5: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co said on Thursday its liver cancer drug brivanib failed to meet the primary endpoint in a late-stage clinical trial.

column4: Text-S&P puts Commonwealth Reit on watch; subsidary IPO cited
column5: OVERVIEW      -- CommonWealth REIT  a U.S. office REIT  announced on Thursday that its newly formed Select Income REIT subsidiary has filed an IPO registration for an initial public offering of shares. CommonWealth intends to contribute 253 properties  including some of its most stable assets  to the subsidiary  which will invest primarily in net-leased  single-tenant properties.      -- We placed our 'BBB' corporate credit rating on CommonWealth on CreditWatch with negative implications  affect

column4: Brazil fines Chevron a further $5.4 million for spill
column5: SAO PAULO Brazil's environment inspector fined Chevron Corp 10 million reais ($5.4 million) for breaching the terms of the U.S. oil company's environmental license when tackling an offshore spill at a well it drilled in November.

column4: Parmalat says U.S. court rejects claim against Citigroup
column5: MILAN  Dec 23 Parmalat said on Friday a U.S. appeal court had affirmed a lower court's decision rejecting its claim against Citigroup in a case connected with the collapse of the Italian diary group in 2003.

column4: Delta facing U.S. class action lawsuit over baggage policy
column5: With so many people flying over the holidays  there's a good chance some of these travelers will end up at their final destination without their luggage. Nearly four of every 1 000 passengers filed a complaint about mishandled bags in 2010 - about 2 million reports in all.

column4: NY man sues airlines over "underwear bomber" plot
column5: NEW YORK A New York man is suing Delta Air Lines and Air France-KLM for $10 million for injuries he says he sustained while helping to stop the so-called "underwear bomber" from blowing up a plane on Christmas Day 2009.

column4: German stocks - Factors to watch on December 23
column5: FRANKFURT  Dec 23 The DAX top-30 index  looked set to open 0.9 percent higher on Friday  according to premarket data from brokerage Lang & Schwarz at 0723 GMT.

column4: Oil rises on supply worries  supportive data
column5: NEW YORK Oil prices rose for a fifth straight day on Friday  on concerns about potential supply disruptions in Iran and Iraq and recent signs of a strengthening U.S. economy. | Video

column4: UPDATE 2-Freeport Indonesia workers to return to work Saturday -union
column5: JAKARTA  Dec 23 Thousands of workers at Freeport McMoRan Copper & Gold Inc's mine in Indonesia will start returning to work on Saturday to end a three-month strike that shook labour relations in Southeast Asia's largest economy.

column4: GE unit to pay $70 million over muni bond bid-rigging
column5: WASHINGTON General Electric Co  acknowledged that three former traders at a finance unit engaged in bid-rigging of municipal bonds and agreed to pay authorities $70.4 million in penalties and damages  the latest settlement in a long-running probe that has ensnared some of the largest financial institutions.

column4: Sales of new athletic shoe bring police to control crowds
column5: CHICAGO Police in several cities around the country on Friday were called to stores to manage unruly shoppers seeking Nike's new Air Jordan athletic shoes.

column4: Total merges solar units  ups SunPower stake
column5: U.S. solar panel maker SunPower Corp  a unit of French oil major Total  said it had agreed to buy Total-owned Tenesol for $165.4 million in cash in an expected deal that will regroup the French group's solar business under one umbrella.

column4: Tyler  The Creator arrested for vandalism
column5: LOS ANGELES Rapper Tyler  The Creator was arrested on suspicion of felony vandalism on Thursday  following a show at a nightclub on the famed Sunset Strip  police said.

column4: United Continental shares off on revenue concerns
column5: Shares of United Continental Holdings  fell about 7 percent on Friday as some analysts cut their fourth-quarter profit estimates  citing weaker-than-expected revenue.
